briefTitle: The Use of Inhaled Corticosteroids in the Treatment of Asthma is Children in the Emergency Room

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Children 2-12 years of age with physician diagnosed asthma or a previous episode of SOB that responded well to Î²2-agonists who present to the ER with moderate or severe asthma exacerbation

Exclusion Criteria:

* Children with mild asthma exacerbation.
* Children with severe asthma exacerbation who are in critical condition or need immediate intervention.
* Children who have heart disease or chronic lung disease other than asthma.
* Systemic steroids administered within the past 7 days.

outcomeMeasures.title: Patients Hospitalization Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of patients hospitalized over the study period (17 months).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Asthma Score From Baseline as Compared to the Score at Disposition
outcomeMeasures.description: A negative change of asthma score from baseline measurement to measurement at disposition, which could be at 2, 3, or 4 hours time points would indicate a decrese in asthma severity. The asthma score ranged between 5 and 15 points as in the protocol, where 5 is the mildest and 15 is the most severe.
